text:
- United Airlines is a
large American airline.
We are in a period of growth.
My team runs the passenger service system,

which is the system that
has everything from the time

that you start shopping
for a ticket till you get
on the plane, including the storage
of all passenger reservations,
tickets, all of those things.

United's Passenger Service
System Shares is a 55-year-old

mainframe application that
has been enhanced over years.
It is very airline legacy constrained.

We are looking for ways to
infuse generative AI at the core
of everything that we do

as we modernize the
passenger service system.

We use Amazon Bedrock
to read a legacy P&R,
our passenger reservation.
It has two digit codes.

It takes six months to
learn how to read it.
Even at its basic level,
it can take years to become proficient.
What we use Amazon Bedrock for was to take
that cryptic P&R

and turn it into something
that is plain English
that anyone can use.
The fact that we could take something
that was a 50-year-old technology

and train Amazon Bedrock to
read what was built 50 years ago

and bring it into modern
times was amazing.
It has changed my team's outlook

on how we're approaching
the modernization.
We're no longer thinking about,
how do we replicate what we have?
We're thinking about how do we innovate,
how do we build better for our customers
and the products that we support?
